intro: Gentiana praecox, commonly known as the early gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Gentiana praecox is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance.
